wiki.content:
"Hella Good" is a song written by Gwen Stefani, Tony Kanal, and The Neptunes for No Doubt's fifth studio album Rock Steady (2001). The song draws influence from electro, rock, and funk music. It received positive reviews from music critics, who made comparisons to the work of a diverse range of artists such as Afrika Bambaataa and Madonna.
 
 "Hella Good" was released as the album's second single in April 2002. It was moderately successful, and Roger Sanchez's remix of the song topped the Billboard Hot Dance Music/Club Play. At the 45th Grammy Awards, "Hella Good" was nominated for Best Dance Recording, and Sanchez's remix won for Best Remixed Recording, Non-Classical. A black-and-white music video was produced, featuring the band squatting in an abandoned ship.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Hella Good" is a song written by Gwen Stefani, Tony Kanal, and The Neptunes for No Doubt's fifth studio album Rock Steady (2001). The song draws influence from electro, rock, and funk music. It received positive reviews from music critics, who made comparisons to the work of a diverse range of artists such as Afrika Bambaataa and Madonna.  "Hella Good" was released as the album's second single in April 2002.

track.name: Hella Good
comments: Fab song. Would have been an amazing Britney track too
I never knew this song was from them lol
you hold me like you should so I'm gonna keep on dancing!
Why is this the only No Doubt song that'll ever play for me on my mix radio!?! Come on, Last.FM...surely you guys have It's My Life and Hey Baby in your collection SOMEWHERE! -_-;

I like the song, but my sister thinks it's way too old, because it's 'pop' music. I don't understand, because it was made in 2002, and a song doesn't get old based on its genre. That's like saying something's spoiled, because of its color and not because the ingredients themselves are old.
THE WAVES KEEP ON CRASHIN ON ME 4 SUM REASON
♥ one of their very best imo
neptunes production. This song is hella good. [21]
